climbs.name: East Peak of Gothics - "North East" Ridge
climbs.fa: Ben Ferris, Andy Kaufmann & W.L.Putnam Jul 1948

content.description:
An interesting, modest climb to a summit with amazing views. Might be combined with an ascent of Pioneer.

From Fairy Meadow take the path up and through Friendship Col and onto the Gothics Glacier. Hike right, passing the south ridge of Sentinel, and continue to the East Peak- Pioneer col.  Climb the (usually) steep snow slope up the north/northeast ridge until stopped by a prominent rock step.

Here the original route traverses to the left on slab (snow covered in 1948, ice covered when we did it, possibly rock slab today) Considerable exposure here! (I used a short-thin Lost Arrow for "protection".

Make the ice/snow traverse ( photos) to an obvious crack / chimney in the rock and climb this to the top of the step. Continue on easier rock to a second step, which is bypassed to the west (right) by a ledge, up a 5.4 corner-crack, continuing right ( by passing a more difficult-looking corner) to an exposed 5.3-5.4 crack-corner which leads back up to the ridge and summit.[see topo] 

I believe the direct ascent of the first step has been done, about 5.8 


Short-thin Lost Arrow piton (or knifeblade), maybe a small assortment of nuts/cams for the crack.

From Fairy Meadow, climb through Friendship Col to the Gothics Glacier, thence across to the East Ridge.   
  
 Gain the E Ridge and follow it to the summit, staying slightly below the crest on the south side. (See photo)

Thor is the long, ridge-like Mtn on the south-east side of the Gothics Glacier
Rope and a couple of slings.

climbs.name: Pioneer - East Ridge from Gothics Glacier

content.description:
Highly recommended over the very steep snow-slog “Standard Route” from the East Peak-Pioneer Col.

From Friendship Col move right on the Gothics Glacier bypassing the South Ridge of Sentenel and then head for the Pioneer-Sentenel Col ( aka “Pioneer Pass”, also reachable from Fairy Meadow by way of the Granite Glacier) .

Continue up snow and onto the rock of the East Ridge. Easy Class 5 rock to the summit of Pioneer.

For photos, see “Pioneer via Pioneer Pass and East Ridge” in sub-area “North Faces” 



See Description

Small rack of mostly larger stuff.  Long slings to sling or thread rocks.

climbs.name: Pioneer - Std Route (South Face)
climbs.fa: Howard Palmer, F.K. Butters, E.W. Holway  1911

content.description:
From Friendship Col (or from Sir Sandford Camp via Thor Pass as Palmer & Co. did in 1911) gain the Gothics Glacier. Swing west passing South Ridge of Sentinel and gain the col between East Peak and Pioneer.  

Climb the steep snow slope of Pioneer's south face and scramble up easy rock to the summit. Ah...but which one?!  All part of the fun.  To be honest, I forget which!  Last time I was there was 1982. 



West of Sentinel

climbs.name: Sentinel - South Ridge (Std Route)
climbs.fa: Sterling Hendricks, C. Hayworth, D.Hubbard, S.Moore, & A. Wexler  1946

content.description:
This is the route of first ascent of the mountain.

From Friendship Col swing around right and intercept the obvious South ridge. Class 2  and occasional Class 3 along the ridge leads to a summit with amazing views in all directions! 

In 1967 this was the first 10,000 ft mountain I climbed ( although by another route on the northeast side, starting below Fiendship Col) . Since then surveys have knocked a few feet off the summit. 



Friendship Col to Gothics glacier to South Ridge.

Glacier travel stuff.

This sub- area will include the climbs rising from the Gothics Glacier, usually accessed from a Fairy Meadow base camp, going up through Friendship Col.  

Of course, you can always “make like Palmer” did in 1910-1912 and march onto the Gothics glacier from a camp low in the woods on what is now known as Palmer Creek, (tributary of the Goldstream River) far below the Sir Sandford glacier. 

Imagine, if you will, the expanse of the Gothics Glacier as viewed from Friendship Col as large cirque. Climbs will be organized Left to Right ( clockwise) as viewed from someone who has just crested Friendship Col and is now standing on the Gothics Glacier.
